reviews.review_msg: Simon is such a nice guy, and really cares about his students. It's also clear that he is very passionate about entrepreneurship. The classes are very chill, and he actually makes the course content fun to learn about.

Dave's rubrics are extremely vague and everyone receives roughly the same grade, which makes it difficult to estimate your grade given that 338 is a curved class. It is clear that Dave teaches based on his own biases and is not open to hearing different views from students. Basically just tell him that he's right and you'll get a good grade.

Dave is a nice and engaging prof but his grading rubric is either non-existent or it doesn't make sense. You are graded on an individual assignment, 2 quizzes, 3 group presentations, and a final report but the margins for the grade average vary by 0.1 points. I'm not kidding you. You won't know what your final grade will be until the end.
Great lecturer and a very good working professor that teaches you valuable real life information.

Dave is a nice guy, knows his stuff and is a good mentor for those who are begginers in entrepreneurship, however he is a very hard marker/ hard to please & 65% of your grade is based on a group project which includes doing  work for a real start up company (very hands on), so it will either make you or break you! + the curve

I had the pleasure of taking bus 338 with professor Harries. Great professor which believes in learning rather than tests. If you get involved and read the textbook, apply what you learn, and are passionate about the subject. then this course is very easy.
Arrogant and rude. Dismissive attitude towards students.
If you take entrepreneurship with Sarah, two things will happen... You WILL launch an enterprise, and you WILL want to study entrepreneurship more!
Sarah is enthusiastic, fun and fair.  I liked taking 338 with her!

Sarah is the epitome of a professor. She is very passionate about her course content and she truly cares for her students in and out of the classroom. Her entrepreneurial experiences really make the class memorable and educational. I cannot explain how much her advice and knowledge helped me through my journey as an aspiring entrepreneur.

You have to try really hard to get on her bad side. Amazing prof! Truly inspires entrepreneurship and is always direct and willing to help out. Doesn't provide useless readings which I love and makes each lecture very open and social. One of the best courses I have taken so far. Make sure you have a strong group for your project though!

Sarah's passion for entrepreneurship really shows. I loved how she explained concepts by referencing the start-ups she's worked with. However, her teaching methodology really lacks in one area: grading criteria. Her grading criteria is vague and ambiguous and left my group feeling lost. Nonetheless, she was always available for clarification.
She is absolutely amazing! It is a must take with her if you are doing entrepreneurship at SFU!

Sarah is without a doubt the most amazing professor at SFU! She is easily the most inspiring and lovely person I have ever met! A great professor who knows how to teach! Take this class with her and you will be a better business student and who knows, may even become an Entrepreneur!

The class was quite easy. Although, make sure everyone is graded equally for final project. If not, Doug will skew the marks meaning if youre group got an A, but you did not get an equal mark, you may only get a B. There was a span of 1.5 letter grades across our group project mark. This was not clear before hand.

He is an alright prof, but he's not very clear with the grading criteria. The class involves working with a real world company/ client which is a bit intimidating, but there were only very little guidance given. The pop quizzes aren't very bad, they are just from the slides, just make sure to be in class on time.

This was possibly one of the best classes in SFU Business. We had the chance to design an iPhone application as well as enter the RBC Next Great Innovator Challenge. Jan is one of the best profs I've had so far, very helpful/friendly/loves the students. He has convinced me the Innovation concentration is for me and I'll be taking 450 with him next.
